summary: This is an internal email from a Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, inquiring about case assignment procedures and specifically asking if someone will be working on the Epstein case.

persons.name: Co-Chief, Public Corruption Unit
persons.context: Author of an internal email at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, inquiring about case assignment procedures for the Epstein case.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The email is dated June 26, 2019, indicating internal discussions about the Epstein case were ongoing at that time.
The inquiry comes from a Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit, suggesting the case may have had potential public corruption dimensions or was being managed within that unit.
The email asks about standard case assignment to a paralegal, indicating procedural planning for the Epstein case within the SDNY.
The document shows the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively managing the Epstein case in mid-2019.
